Title: the focus attenuation

Raj: Hey, I read that someone invented a way to convert your footsteps into electromagnetic energy so you can charge your cell phone while walking.
Easy. Sleeping with Penny.
Tricking Penny into getting engaged.
Ooh, we could have one of those retreats.
We could go up to Big Bear and get a house on the lake.
Nothing bad happens in The Lake House.
Hey.
Why not?
For your information, Emily is working tonight.
Ooh, this is exciting. We’re innovating. I feel like we’re in the Facebook movie.
Oh. It’s wonderful, and I swear I’m not saying that because Justin Timberlake is in it.
Cool. I’ll make the popcorn.
Boy, when you met Bernadette, the field of robotics really took a hit.
Hey, the future they show in Back to the Future II is only a year away. A lot of the things in that movie haven’t been invented yet.
Oh, I have an idea.
I’ll make the popcorn.
He’s right. Also, what kind of name is Biff? Sounds like when you pop open a can of Pillsbury dough. Biff.

Plus, this is where our minds are conditioned to focus on work.
Go online and look it up.

Hey, it was match point.
Not getting to see who wins at pigeon ping-pong comes to mind.
And I really can’t let that happen or the girl who does my eyebrows will think I’ve been cheating on her.

No way. Not Bill Murray.
Huh. Bill Murray did get it wrong.
Yeah, sorry for clicking on that.

That’s not what happened.

Well, maybe we have lost our focus.
Then we’ll go to a hotel.
Fine. Then we’ll just stay here and do it.
You would go to a beach house?

They seem okay with it.
Hey.

I, I think I still have it.

Had will have placed?

Wait. Is brought right?
I don’t know. You did it to me.
Guys.

All right.

I’m sure Mrs. Florida’s walking funny. Can we get back to work?
Some psychologists perform operant conditioning with punishment. Maybe we can come up with a punishment for straying off topic.
If only we had one.
Okay, so we agree, whenever someone takes us off topic they get their arm hair yanked off.
All right, now, one benefit of quantum coupling…
I think it’ll be pretty clear. If not, we’ll take a vote. Oh, and also…
We didn’t have to, that was clearly a tangent. Now come on. Back to work. If we’re leaning towards quantum coupling… Aah! Why?
Thank you. And now I owe you one.
Everyone stop. This was a stupid idea. Negative reinforcement isn’t working.
No.
Look. We keep procrastinating. We saw Back to the Future II, pigeons playing ping-pong, a bunch of countries that look like genitals and one guy whose genitals look like Denmark.
It’s late. We’ve wasted hours. Can we please find it in ourselves to do any amount of work tonight?
So you’re, you’re saying we should stand here in my lab on a Saturday night and watch the rest of Ghostbusters on a crappy laptop?
It really does hold up.
Howard: Probably because we left the diagram of it in the restaurant, and none of us wanted to walk back.
No one wants to hear it.
Getting Penny to go back out with him after she dumped him.

It wouldn’t kill us to get together and brainstorm ideas.

Hey. I didn’t think you’d make it.

Here we go.
Oh. I never saw that.

Mm, that was mine.
Also mine.

Hold on. Pause. Something doesn’t make sense. Look, in 2015, Biff steals the sports almanac and takes the time machine back to 1955, to give it to his younger self. But as soon as he does that, he changes the future, so the 2015 he returns to would be a different 2015, not the 2015 that Marty and Doc were in.
What?
Oh, that stuff is so good wrapped around cocktail weenies.
Or if we could figure out a way to supercool the materials, we could utilize quantum coupling.
Oh, I can’t argue with him. It’s right there on the screen. Austria does look like a wiener.
Like behavior modification?
We could snap a rubber band on our wrists every time we get sidetracked.
That’s ridiculous. Sheldon, I vote that is not a tangent.
Hey.
Negative reinforcement is really wrong?
Jump ahead to the Stay Puft Marshmallow Man.
Sheldon: I know the real reason you never made progress with that idea. You thought of it September 22nd, 2007. Two days later, Penny moved in, and so much blood rushed to your genitals, your brain became a ghost town.
I remember it distinctly because I had just composed my annual poem commemorating the anniversary of Dr. Seuss’s death.
Why, die. Why did he die? Old, told. I was told he was old.
Oh, really? Since meeting her, what have been your greatest accomplishments?
Well, don’t feel bad. I think we’ve all been distracted since the girls entered our lives.
Oh, very much so. Listen to this. This is from two days ago. Hi. Hope you’re having a good day. Who has time for this constant sexting?
I’m not going to a cabin in the woods. Did you see the movie Cabin in the Woods?
A hotel? Did you see The Shining?
Did you see The Lake House?
Yeah, well, no, not to them. To me. Time traveling mailbox. The only time that traveled was an hour and half of my life down the toilet.
Well, you didn’t suggest a beach house.
Well, good Lord, no, have you seen Jaws?
Yeah, one would assume, on getting out of the pit.
Thinking caps on.
Really?
Yeah, I have it on Blu-ray. We should watch it.
I’m sorry. Is that a no?
I did not get a clear answer. I’m gonna set this down now.
Wait. I’m confused. Why would you need both a robot girlfriend and a robot prostitute?

You know, a number of significant innovations have been inspired by science fiction. The, the geosynchronous satellite from Arthur C. Clarke. The Motorola flip phone, that came from Star Trek. I think I have the same one.
Wait. Whoa, whoa. Is placed right?
Is placed the right tense for something that would have happened in the future of a past that was affected by something from the future?
That’s my boy.
Yeah, but he had will haven’t placed it!

Unlike Hot Tub Time Machine, this couldn’t be more simple. When Biff gets the almanac in 1955, the alternate future he creates isn’t the one in which Marty and Doc Brown ever use the time machine to travel to 2015. Therefore, in the new timeline, Marty and Doc never brought the time machine…
Marty and Doc never had have had brought?

Oh, I’m going with it. Marty and Doc never had have had brought the time machine to 2015. That means 2015 Biff could also not had have had brought the almanac to 1955 Biff. Therefore, the timeline in which 1955 Biff gets the almanac is also the timeline in which 1955 Biff never gets the almanac. And not just never gets. Never have, never hasn’t, never had have hasn’t.
Do you know that the word wiener comes from the German name of the Austrian capital Vienna, or Wien?
I don’t think it worked.
Oh, this is already better. There are far fewer distractions in here.
Well, I wonder if anyone’s tried that.
Yeah, he’s right. Oh, here’s a thought. What if we use some form of operant conditioning techniques to keep us from getting off topic?
Yeah, exactly. Did you know those techniques were used to actually teach pigeons to play ping-pong?
Mmm, not bad. You know, in medieval times, idle chatter was punished with a device called the scold’s bridle. It’s an iron cage that’s locked around the head and pierces the tongue.
Oh, I’ll check Amazon.
Wait, a question, who decides if someone’s gone off topic?
Ow. We didn’t vote!
You said quantum coupling. That made me think of the show Quantum Leap. That’s a tangent and it’s your fault.
Ow. That was your fault.
I think you mean positive punishment. Negative reinforcement is the removal of a positive stimulus. It’s a common mistake.
Oh, it’s used incorrectly all the time. Even Bill Murray makes that mistake in the first scene of Ghostbusters.
Leonard’s right. We can’t just jump ahead. We have to watch the whole movie.
But we didn’t see them bust one ghost.
No.

No.

Oh, you will. That’s why they give you the bucket. Uh-oh.
It’s my boss. They moved my field ride up to Monday.
It means instead of having a week to study, I only have two days.
Uh, it’s kind of a lot. You know, let me do a little tonight, and I’ll catch up with you guys later.
Yeah, it’s okay. Go ahead.
Yeah.
You guys look like you’re having fun.
That’s a dollar.
That sounds so great. But I have a little more studying to do.

All right, guys, look, I would love to go out, but I’ve got to get this done, okay? So have fun at the club. And if you get in trouble, find a policeman. And if he’s taking off his pants, he is not a real policeman.
To the walk-in closet? Sure.
Yep. Shake that thing.

So, um, now that Penny’s not coming…
Okay.
Maybe after this, you’ll be in the mood for some Manilow.
Look at us out, while Penny’s in the room studying.
It is. But enough about Penny. Let’s talk about us. We’re looking good.
Better than good. I mean, look at you. Your body’s bangin’.

Oh, don’t be embarrassed. I’ll show you the divot in my spine.
No, no, it’s okay. I was born with it. If you put a double-A battery in there, it makes my leg kick.
We had a complaint about somebody pooping on a party in there.
Why’d you tell her? It was working.
We’re having the best time.
Hey, Penny, hey, let’s go. We found a place that has Australian male strippers.
Can you believe this nerd?

Okay, okay, this is obviously very important to her. Let’s just, we’ll help her study so she can get done quicker. Here, here, I’m gonna quiz you. I’m gonna quiz you. I got your notes. I got your notes. I got your notes. If you want these, they’re gonna be at the strip club.
